column1: ##Project Description=Basic Details: 	  Sample Submission ID	12_778  User	Kawata Manabu  Lab	Lotz  Account Code	(08)RAG049617B(C3-554316)-100.00%  Fee	0.00 USD  Discount	0.00%  Actual Fee	  Quoted Amount	1551.00 USD  Expected Date	  Actual Date	  Service Id	 	 	 Project Information:	 Study title	Lotz_12142020_MK (drugseq) Sample Type description (e.g. Jurkat cell line: liver tissue)	Chondrocytes Species	Human 	 Services:	 Please briefly describe what you would like the Genomics Core to do for you	DRUG-seq 	 Samples:	 Number of Samples submitted	33 How many reads per sample are needed?	3.9 million reads per sample How many reads total for all samples are needed?	One mid output flowcell (130 million reads) 	 Additional Information:	 Would you like Genomics Core to prepare your sequencing libraries?	Yes Which kit? (if not sure: Genomics Core will provide this information)	drugseq protocol Would you like the CCBB to provide data analysis?	Yes We highly recommend completing this section in anticipation of future GEO submissions	 Goal of the Project	To identify genes that are differentially regulated by KLF2 and KLF4 in human chondrocytes Details of requested bioinformatics analyses	DRUG-seq analysis with differentially expressed genes (DEGs) as output. There are the two different experimental conditions: with and without treatment of IL1b. 1) PCA and DEGs in Ad-KLF2/4 vs Ad-EGFP without IL1b	 2) PCA and DEGs in Ad-KLF2/4 vs Ad-EGFP with IL1b	 References to closely related work (optional)	 	 Experimental Variables:	 Variable 1	 Variable 2	 Variable 3	 Variable 4	 Variable 5	 Variable 6	 Variable 7	 	 Service Items:	 DrugSeq	 number of samples	33 Price	10 Total	330 	 Services:	 Service Name	Nextseq 150 cycle kit (Mid Output) Category	Sequencing Kits Group	NetSeq500_kit Price	1221 Quantity	1 Total	1221
